pr_title: EBP: Updates to legacy.scss do not show up properly until theme changes happen

timeline.message:
Use an URLConnection to get the last modified date

As opposed to creating a new File() directly with a .getResource
call - as this fails when legacy.scss is in a jar.

timeline.bodyText:
The logic for this used to be:

!legacyCssExists OR baseSassUpdated

Now it's:

legacyCssExists AND baseSassUpdated

I believe that means on the first run of a fresh system, this will not get generated.
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: Gah! Yup, I forgot the else for the initial legacyCssExists check. Sorry about that.
replies.author: SammyIsConfused

timeline.message: Fix logic to handle case in which compiled css file does not exist
